contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=June 2008}} {{Politics of Réunion}} [[Image:Flag of France.svg|Flag of France|thumb|right]] [[Réunion]], is an [[overseas département]] of France. The island's conventional name is the ''Department of Réunion'', or ''Réunion''. It is also locally referred to as ''Île de la Réunion''. The French flag is used on the island. The island's capital is [[Saint-Denis, Réunion|Saint-Denis]], and the island is divided into four [[arrondissement]]s, 24 [[Communes of France|commune]]s and 47 [[Cantons of France|canton]]s. Réunion is governed by [[French law]], and its constitution is the [[French constitution]] of 28 September 1958. Suffrage is granted universally to all those over the age of 18. The national holiday of the island is 14 July, [[Bastille Day]], commemorating the ''[[Fête de la Fédération]]'' in 1790. The island's data code is "RE". ==Executive Branch== The chief of state is the [[French President]], [[François Hollande]], who is represented by [[Colonial and Departmental Heads of Réunion|Prefect]] [[Jean-Luc Marx]]. The president of the General Council, who acts as head of the government, is [[Nassimah Dindar]]. [[Elections]] held in Réunion include the [[Elections in France|French presidential vote]]. A [[Prefect#Modern_sub-national_administration|prefect]] is appointed by the president on the advice of the [[French Ministry of the Interior]]. The presidents of the General and Regional Councils are elected by members of those councils. ==Legislative Branch== The [[unicameral]] General Council has 47 seats. The unicameral Regional Council has 45 seats.
